meanings.definition: An enzyme produced by the kidneys that helps regulate blood pressure.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that renin is important for controlling blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: The level of renin in the body can impact how high or low the blood pressure is.
meanings.sent3: When renin goes on vacation, the blood pressure throws a party!
meanings.sent4: Renin acts like a traffic controller, directing the flow of blood pressure signals.
meanings.sent5: Imagine renin as a tiny superhero, swooping in to save the day by adjusting blood pressure levels.

meanings.definition: A substance that plays a key role in the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.
meanings.sent1: In the body, renin interacts with other substances to maintain balance.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how renin works within the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.
meanings.sent3: Renin, angiotensin, and aldosterone walk into a bar... to regulate body functions!
meanings.sent4: The renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system is like a team of superheroes fighting to keep things in check.
meanings.sent5: Picture renin as the conductor of a complex orchestra, ensuring harmony among different substances.

meanings.definition: A protein involved in the control of blood pressure.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying how this protein, renin, influences blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on renin to help manage the levels of blood pressure.
